uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.collect
Class SparseVector

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.collect.SparseVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SparseDoubleVector
public abstract class SparseVector
extends Object
implements Serializable

Abstract super class defining common operation of list based sparse vector representation for different primitive types. This is an ideal representation for performing fast dot product, or any other operation that ignores zero values, if the denisity is sufficiently low. Other operations can be slower than a full vector because indicies must be searched for. Vector have a fixed dimentionality. Once constructed they cannot change from their initialized cardinality. TODO: There could potentially be a warnings about excess density that would cause the structure to become inefficient. This will first require an experiment to see what that density is. However this should not be implmented in this class which has no way of knowing what kind of warning would be appropriate, if at all. (Issue #27)

Author:
Hamish Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

protected static final int DEFAULT_CAPACITY

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GROWTH_FACTOR

protected static final double GROWTH_FACTOR
When the capacity is exausted, they storage will be expanded by the this factor plus 1. For example if the store is 10 then it will become 16.

Constructor Detail

SparseVector

protected SparseVector(int[] keys,
                       int cardinality,
                       int size)
                throws NullPointerException,
                       IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
Dependancy inject constructure for testing and other internal purposes.

Parameters:
keys - Array containing the ordered indices of all non-zero values.
cardinality - The number of dimensions
size - The number of keys actually used.
Throws:
NullPointerException - when argument keys is null
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if keys is smaller than cardinality, or keys is negative, or size is smaller that keys or size is negative, or the largest value in keys is greater than cardinality, or the keys contains a negative value.
IllegalArgumentException - if cardinality is negative

Method Detail

cardinality

public final int cardinality()
The dimentionality of this vector. Not to be confused with the length (magnitude) or the number of elements actually used.

Returns:
the dimentionality of the vector space

size

public final int size()
The number of storage elements required to represent this vector. This will be equal to the number of non-zero elements in the vector.

Returns:
number of storage elements required

capacity

public final int capacity()
The number of storage elements available before the internal array must be grown.

Returns:
store elements available.

density

public final double density()
The proportion of this vectors dimensions which contain non-zero values. Where 0.0 indicates there are no non-zero elements, and 1.0 indicate that every element is non-zero. Returns 0.0 for null (0 cardinality) vectors.

Returns:
proportion of usage as a value in the range 0.0 to 1.0

empty

public final boolean empty()
Whether this vector contains any non-zero elements.

Returns:
false if there is a non-zero element, true otherwise.

keys

Deprecated. 

Warning: This method returns a copy of keys so can be quite slow.

Returns:
a copy of the keys array.
